title: The hacker has access to the administrative part of the management reports in publish report

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
Hi team, @jobert, @bencode . At the moment, I'm not entirely sure that this has a strong effect. But I also assume that this should not be on behalf of the hacker, and also in the future it may create problems, for example when you add new statuses for the report and they will have some impact on the report.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. https://hackerone.com/hacktivity/publish
2. Create publish report
3. When we create a report, we can see that there is nothing we can do with it

`{"can_manage?":false,"can_export?":false,"can_add_comment?":false,"can_change_state?":false,"can_reopen?":false,
"can_award_bounty?":false,"can_award_swag?":false,"can_suggest_bounty_amount?":false,"can_assign_to_user?":false,
"can_assign_to_h1_triage?":false,"can_hide_timeline?":false,"can_agree_on_going_public?":false,
"can_cancel_disclosure_request?":false,"can_be_publicly_disclosed?":false,"can_post_internal_comments?":false,
"can_manage_common_responses?":false,"can_use_common_responses?":false,"can_reassign_to_team?":false,
"can_change_title?":false,"can_change_weakness?":false,"can_be_manually_disclosed?":false,"can_clone?":false,
"can_close?":false,"can_ban_researcher?":false,"can_create_severity?":true,"can_close_comments?":false,
"can_change_structured_scope?":false,"can_manage_collaborators?":false,"can_view_bounty_weights?":true,
"can_redact?":false,"can_view_credential_account_details?":true,"can_create_retest?":false,"can_request_retest?":false,
"can_manage_link_sharing?":false,"assignable_team_members":[],"assignable_team_member_groups":[]}
`
and `"comments_closed?":true`

There is nothing we can do, including the fact that we can't write comments , However, a hacker can use the admin panel to change the status.
█████████

4. Use this request, we can changed status 
https://hackerone.com/reports/bulk

POST:

```
message=test&substate=triaged&reference=&add_reporter_to_original=false&reply_action=change-state&mark_ineligible_for_bounty=false&reports_count=1&report_ids%5B%5D=ID_PUBLISH_REPORT&bounty_currency=USD
```
`substate=triaged` and `reply_action=change-state` - Change the report to the triaged status

{F817883}

The report which was in the tests: #867226 , #867195 , #867197 , #867218

## Impact

Changes to the publish report status
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:
Hi team, @jobert, @bencode . At the moment, I'm not entirely sure that this has a strong effect. But I also assume that this should not be on behalf of the hacker, and also in the future it may create problems, for example when you add new statuses for the report and they will have some impact on the report.

Steps To Reproduce

  1. https://hackerone.com/hacktivity/publish
  2. Create publish report
  3. When we create a report, we can see that there is nothing we can do with it

activities.message:
Hi @haxta4ok00,

Your request currently returns the following error message:

```
Your browser sent outdated parameters and therefore the server was unable to process the
request. Please go back, refresh the page and try again. If the error persists, please contact us.
```

I'll check this internally with one of my colleagues and be back as soon as there's more info to share.

Thanks for your patience,
@lugtag

activities.message:
Hi @lugtag -- Do you specify your token in the request? , OK, I'll help you make your request easier.

1) Create sandbox program in H1 platform - https://hackerone.com/teams/new/sandbox
2) After you create the program, you will see a demo report from the bot.
3) Put this report in the triaged state, and catch this request, you will have it with your token
4) Create publish report - https://hackerone.com/hacktivity/publish
5) Take the report number and change it in request # 3

I think your problem is that you create a POST request without a CSRF token

████████
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @lugtag -- Do you specify your token in the request? , OK, I'll help you make your request easier.

1) Create sandbox program in H1 platform - https://hackerone.com/teams/new/sandbox
2) After you create the program, you will see a demo report from the bot.
3) Put this report in the triaged state, and catch this request, you will have it with your token
4) Create publish report - https://hackerone.com/hacktivity/publish
5) Take the report number and change it in request # 3

I think your problem is that you create a POST request without a CSRF token

████████

activities.message:
To @lugtag , @jobert , @bencode -- A small addition.
I checked this via GraphQL

`{"query":"mutation Create_or_update_jira_integration_mutation($input_0:UpdateReportStateToResolvedInput!){updateReportStateToResolved(input:$input_0) {errors{edges{node{field,message,type}}},was_successful}}","variables":{"input_0":{"message":"test","report_id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1JlcG9ydC84NjcyMjY=","clientMutationId":"0"}}}`

`Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1JlcG9ydC84NjcyMjY=` -- `gid://hackerone/Report/867226`

Answer:

***"field":null,"message":"Insufficient permissions","type":"AUTHORIZATION"***

Via GraphQL, I can't change the report state, and that's correct

GraphQL tells us that we have `Insufficient permissions` to this action
So I think this is a bug
Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:

Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1JlcG9ydC84NjcyMjY= -- gid://hackerone/Report/867226

Answer:

"field":null,"message":"Insufficient permissions","type":"AUTHORIZATION"

Via GraphQL, I can't change the report state, and that's correct

GraphQL tells us that we have Insufficient permissions to this action
So I think this is a bug
Thanks!

activities.message: Interesting find @haxta4ok00, it looks like our ACL rules for what the UI thinks you can do are out of line with what you are allowed. I don't see any specific action here that would be security impacting though. Did you see any impact from your investigations?
activities.markdown_message: Interesting find @haxta4ok00, it looks like our ACL rules for what the UI thinks you can do are out of line with what you are allowed. I don't see any specific action here that would be security impacting though. Did you see any impact from your investigations?

activities.message:
Hi @bencode -- 
* I know that these reports affect the parameter : `Last report resolved`
* I don't know if these status changes affect the parameters : `Average time to first response`, `Average time to triage`, `Average time to resolution`  or another parameters, If you change them at different times 
* I thought that in the future, engineers may create other statuses that, for example, could trigger an action(but I may be wrong here) , For example, the status is retesting , I can't check this because I need a program where this feature is enabled. This will trigger the retest function?

Who knows what kind of connection may appear here in the future after updates / additions to the reporting functionality, with incorrect authorization
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @bencode --

  • I know that these reports affect the parameter : Last report resolved
  • I don't know if these status changes affect the parameters : Average time to first response, Average time to triage, Average time to resolution or another parameters, If you change them at different times
  • I thought that in the future, engineers may create other statuses that, for example, could trigger an action(but I may be wrong here) , For example, the status is retesting , I can't check this because I need a program where this feature is enabled. This will trigger the retest function?

Who knows what kind of connection may appear here in the future after updates / additions to the reporting functionality, with incorrect authorization

activities.message: Thanks @haxta4ok00, it's something we'll keep an eye on, but don't plan to make any specific changes here at the moment. Hope you are well!
activities.markdown_message: Thanks @haxta4ok00, it's something we'll keep an eye on, but don't plan to make any specific changes here at the moment. Hope you are well!

activities.message:
Hi @bencode , @jobert , and team!

>I don't see any specific action here that would be security impacting though. Did you see any impact from your investigations?

It looks like I found it now!

If you open the documentation [docs](https://docs.hackerone.com/programs/report-states.html) , Then we will see state - `Needs More Info`.
From my observations, if I'm not mistaken, it only works with legal programs(without sandboxes).

Thanks to this report, we can just change any report(published) to this state and after 30 days, see if the bot closes the report or not.



1) #978377 by █████

███

2) #981359 by ████

█████████

As we can see, after 30 days, the bot closed my report only in the report sent to ██████████ , I also received this notification to my email.

From this, I conclude that by changing the status of the report to needs-more-info , after 30 days we can determine whether the program has a private part( invite-only) or not

To: triager_team , Could you assign this to the team?
To: @jobert ,@bencode - Can you review this report and look into the internal code to check it out?

Thanks!

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - whoa, well done, you did it again! Changing it to Needs More Information and waiting 30 days indeed reveals if they run an invite-only program. We're reopening this ticket and will assign it to a team to fix it. Thanks, really well done!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - whoa, well done, you did it again! Changing it to Needs More Information and waiting 30 days indeed reveals if they run an invite-only program. We're reopening this ticket and will assign it to a team to fix it. Thanks, really well done!

activities.message: Hi @jobert - Thanks for the answer! As I said, it may be worse in the future if a new trigger is created that performs some actions like in this example :)

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - we just pushed a fix for this! Published reports won't be automatically closed and we removed the logic that prevented the closing from happening for sandboxed programs. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, this was a great creative find!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - we just pushed a fix for this! Published reports won't be automatically closed and we removed the logic that prevented the closing from happening for sandboxed programs. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, this was a great creative find!
Hi @jobert -- it's good work!
